item.title: Pump Low Pressure Indication Systems – Pump LOW PRESS Lights

remarks.para: One light per hydraulic system may be inoperative provided:

numlitem.para: Associated system pressure indication is verified to be operative, and
Associated pump is operative before each departure.

note.para: If requested, Confirm affected pump(s) operation after flight with maintenance, prior to shutdown.

numlitem.para: If Demand Pump LOW PRESS light is inoperative:
Ensure exterior flight control/gear areas are clear prior to pressurizing hydraulic system.
With the pneumatic manifold pressurized and electrical power on the aircraft, turn affected pump(s) to AUTO or ON.
System synoptic hydraulic display on EICAS must read between 2800-3200 psi.
If Engine Driven Pump LOW PRESS light is inoperative:
After engine start and prior to blockout, turn associated system Demand Pump(s) OFF.
System synoptic hydraulic display on EICAS must read between 2800-3200 psi.
Return associated Demand Pump(s) to AUTO.
To satisfy repetitive inspection requirement, enter comment in Logbook after check.

note.para: Do not operate pumps for more than 15 minutes with less than 3000 lbs of fuel in each main tank (1 thru 4) due to possible pump overheat.

placard.para: Placard the affected Pump Low Pressure Light(s): "INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

note.para: The repetitive inspection required when this item is inoperative must be documented in the Aircraft Logbook at the prescribed intervals. (Refer to GMM, Chapter 3, Section 6.)

maintenance.para: Check affected pump operation as follows:

caution.para: DO NOT OPERATE PUMPS FOR MORE THAN 15 MINUTES WITHOUT MINIMUM QUANTITIES IN FUEL TANKS DUE TO POSSIBLE PUMP OVERHEAT.

numlitem.para: Air Drive Pump (ADP) or AC Motor-Driven Pump (ACMP):
Ensure that personnel are clear of flight controls.
With electrical power on aircraft, and pneumatic manifold pressurized, turn HYD PUMPS DEMAND switch to AUTO or ON.
System hydraulic pressure display on EICAS must read between 2800-3200 psig.
Restore aircraft to its required configuration.

With affected engine running, perform same check as for ADP/ACMP above. This check could also be performed by the flight crew prior to shuttling down engines on previous flight, or just prior to departure.
